content.description:
Start standing to the right of the arete, climb straight up through the dihedral, and either make a very difficult triple bump sequence to the lip with the right hand or simply jump for the lip. It is similar in difficulty either way. A beta video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2vjHOpAg68o

.
content.location: It is right of the arete.

content.description:
This is an amazing line that starts sitting just right of the arete on a right hand, jug sidepull and a small micro,crimp at about 2 feet. Climb straight up the dihedral through

Years Ago

.
content.location: Start with a sit to the right of the arete.

content.description:
Wonderful is an amazing line started sitting under the massive ledge at the base of the prow of the boulder. Climb right into

Years Ago

. A beta video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vCb1i3S03XA

.
content.location: Start sitting below the massive ledge on the prow matched on the sidepull jug.

content.description:
Start sitting just to the right of the arete on a jug sidepull and left hand micro-crimp on the large foot shelf at 3 feet. Head up the dihedral, and exit right via an amazing, left hand cross, double clutch. A beta video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1q3kGqmK5x8

.
content.location: Start sitting at the right side of the arete.

content.description:
Start as for the sit starts to

Years Ago

and

Magnum 40

. Head right through sidepulls and tiny crimps! Beta video:

https://youtube.com/shorts/FtDthSAxJTU?feature=share

.
content.location:
Do the same start as the right sit start for

Years Ago

/

T Pain’s Wild Ride

/[121428191]].

content.description:
Don't think too hard, this is a warm up with fun lip surfing to start the session. Contrive at will to increase the difficulty.

Start with ringlocks, or not it's a free country, then bust to the lip.

Or more fun, go left onto the good face holds and then up.
content.location: Rightmost on the wall. Obvious low crack

content.description:
Neosporin is an eliminate. Start on the blocky jug on the right side of the wall. Climb

Scrape

backwards, staying below the incut crimps on

T Pains Wild Ride

, and finish on

Years Ago

. Be tall.

Climb

Neosporin

(reversing

Scrape

essentially - except you don't bother with going into the start holds), and you still avoid the crimps of

Joy

up high.

Then transition into

Audubon

at the point where you end up with your left hand on the jug sidepull and your right hand on the funky crimp in the pod. Then finish straight up

Audubon

.

Magnum 40 is a wonderful line put up by Adam Frederick in 2004! Start standing with your left hand on a jug sidepull and a  right hand crimp at about 4 or 5 feet. Bump your left hand to a sidepull, get a right heel hook, and cross your right hand to a tiny crimp. Hold the swing, and climb above the massive ledge to the arete. The right sit start goes at v7. Climb to the top. A beta video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b9vMF8nOmVM

..

Sit start video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=51i-n8rvMqs
Start compressing on the left hand jug/flat edge just to the right of the sloping, right-facing jug rail (sit start position) & your right hand on the sloping edge with a small crimp.

Joy is an amazing line that sits under the massive ledge with your right hand on the sidepull jug and climbs into Paul's line that exit with an amazing, cross-through, double clutch just right of "

Years Ago

". A beta video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a_iAeODyLcA

.
content.location: Start sitting on the ledge at the base of the prow.

content.description:
One of few obvious lines on the boulder, this fun route takes the arete all the way to the apex of the boulder. This is a good warm up with a nice preview of the ending of Magnum 40.

Start in the big low jug right of the arete and make a big move to the arete. A slightly awkward mantle brings you to some delicate arete+face moves to good holds at the lip.

A little reachy, could be V4.
content.protection: 2 or 3 pads, slight slope to the landing.
content.location: The right arete of Pride rock.

content.description:
Audubon is sharp but so amazing. It is an obvious line that climbs the center of the prow. Start on a low, left hand, jug sidepull at 3ish feet and right hand on a sidepull crimp. The left and right sits don’t change grade but make it a bit harder.

Beta videos:

https://youtube.com/shorts/8E16KUzAJZo?feature=share

and

https://youtube.com/shorts/1mbmE6yNX8Y?feature=share

.
content.location:
Start the same as “

Years Ago

stand and

Magnum 40

stand.”
